questionsSolved.userSolution:
select concat(first_name,' ', last_name) as 'full_name'
from patients;

select first_name, last_name, max(height)
from patients;

select * from patients
where patient_id in (1,45,534,879,1000);

select count(*) as 'total_admissions'
from admissions;

select * from admissions
where admission_date = discharge_date;

select distinct city from patients
where province_id like 'NS';

select distinct city from patients
where city like 'a%' or
	  city like 'e%' or
      city like 'i%' or
      city like 'o%' or
      city like 'u%'
order by city asc;

select first_name
from patients
group by first_name
having count(patient_id) = 1;

select t1.patient_id, t1.first_name, t1.last_name
from patients as t1
inner join admissions as t2 on t1.patient_id=t2.patient_id
where t2.diagnosis = 'Dementia';

SELECT 
    SUM(CASE WHEN gender = 'M' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as male_count,
    SUM(CASE WHEN gender = 'F' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as female_count
FROM patients;

select first_name, last_name, allergies
from patients
where allergies in ('Penicillin','Morphine')
order by allergies asc, first_name, last_name;

select patient_id, diagnosis
from admissions
group by diagnosis, patient_id
having count(*) > 1;

select city, count(patient_id) as 'num_patients'
from patients
group by city
order by num_patients desc, city asc;

select first_name, last_name, 'Patient' as role
from patients
union all 
select first_name, last_name, 'Doctor'
from doctors;

select allergies, count(*) as 'total_diagnosis'
from patients
where allergies is not NULL
group by allergies
order by total_diagnosis desc;

SELECT first_name, last_name, birth_date
FROM patients
WHERE birth_date >= '1970-01-01' AND birth_date < '1980-01-01'
ORDER BY birth_date ASC;

select concat(upper(last_name),',',lower(first_name)) as 
'new_name_format'
from patients
order by first_name desc;

select t2.province_id, sum(t1.height) as 'sum_height'
from patients as t1
Inner join province_names as t2 on 
		t1.province_id = t2.province_id
group by t2.province_id
having sum_height >= 7000;

select day(admission_date) as 'day_number',
	   count(*) as 'num_of_admissions'
from admissions
group by day_number
order by num_of_admissions desc;

select *
from admissions
where patient_id = 542
group by patient_id
having
  admission_date = max(admission_date);

select
  patient_id,
  attending_doctor_id,
  diagnosis
from admissions
where
  (
    patient_id % 2 = 1
    and attending_doctor_id in (1, 5, 19)
  )
  or (
    attending_doctor_id like '%2%'
    and len(patient_id) = 3
  );

select
  t1.first_name,
  t1.last_name,
  count(*) as 'admissions_total'
from doctors as t1
  INNer join admissions as t2 on 
  t1.doctor_id = t2.attending_doctor_id

group by t1.doctor_id
having admissions_total;

select
  t1.doctor_id,
  concat(t1.first_name,' ',t1.last_name) as full_name,
  min(t2.admission_date) as first_admission_date,
  max(t2.admission_date) as last_admission_date
from doctors as t1
  INNer join admissions as t2 on 
  t1.doctor_id = t2.attending_doctor_id
group by t1.doctor_id;

select t2.province_name, count(*) as patient_count
from patients as t1
INNer join province_names as t2 on 
t1.province_id = t2.province_id
group by t2.province_id
order by patient_count desc;

select
  concat(t1.first_name, ' ', t1.last_name) as patient_name,
  t2.diagnosis,
  concat(t3.first_name, ' ', t3.last_name) as doctor_name
from patients as t1
  INNer join admissions as t2 on t1.patient_id = t2.patient_id
  INNer join doctors as t3 on t2.attending_doctor_id = t3.doctor_id

select first_name, last_name, count(*) as num_of_duplicate
from patients
group by first_name, last_name
having count(*) > 1;

select 
	concat(first_name, ' ', last_name) 
    as patient_name,
    round((height/30.48),1) as 'height "feet"',
    round((weight*2.205),0) as 'weight "pounds"',
    birth_date,
    case
    	when gender='M' then 'Male'
        else 'Female'
    end as gender_type
from patients;

select floor(weight/10)*10 as weight_group, count(*)
from patients
group by weight_group
order by weight_group desc;

SELECT
  patient_id,
  weight,
  height,
  CASE
    WHEN weight / POWER(height / 100.0, 2) >= 30 THEN 1
    ELSE 0
  END AS isObese
FROM patients;
